com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVRestController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVRestController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/api")
public class TEVRestController
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the REST controller for the TEV application. The entire RESTful API is exposed via this Controller, with methods/API calls for working with posts (including special kinds of posts, such as "regular" and "photo" posts), metadata, and "types".

    In general, a "more is better than less" approach has been taken -- some APIs have been created even if they aren't used by the TEV application, just in case.

    Author:
    tiyb

      • fixPhotosForPost

        @GetMapping(value="/posts/{id}/fixPhotos")
public java.lang.Boolean fixPhotosForPost(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                     java.lang.Long postId)
        The Tumblr export doesn't always include every image, for some reason. However, in many cases the images referred to in the image URLs from Tumblr's export XML still exist on Tumblr's servers. So, in cases where a post is missing its images, this API can be used to fetch the images from Tumblr's servers (according to their URLs in the XML), download them, and save them to the media directory being used by TEV, using the naming convention Tumblr would have used, if the images had been included in the export.
        Parameters:
        postId - The ID of the post to be "fixed"
        Returns:
        bool indicating whether the action completed successfully or not.

                                                                       java.lang.Long postId,
                                                                       @Valid @RequestBody
                                                                       @Valid Regular regular)

        Parameters:
        postId - The ID of the post to which this "regular" post content refers
        regular - The data to be submitted
        Returns:
        The same Regular object that was submitted.

      • getAllTypes

        @GetMapping(value="/types")
public java.util.List<Type> getAllTypes()
        GET to return all Types stored in the system. If there are no types, a hard-coded list of types is created. (Was originally done in data.sql, but that no longer works in this implementation.)
        Returns:
        List<> of Type objects

      • getMetadata

        @GetMapping(value="/metadata")
public Metadata getMetadata()
        GET to return the metadata stored in the system. Only one record will ever be stored in the metadata table, so the API assumes one and only oen Metadata object.
        Returns:
        The Metadata object stored in the database, or an empty object if the table has no data.

      • getStaticListData

        @GetMapping(value="/metadata/staticListData")
public StaticListData getStaticListData()
        GET to return static data used to populate drop-down lists, for the user to set things like preferred sort order, filters, etc.
        Returns:
        object containing the different lists of strings available

      • updateMetadata

        @PutMapping(value="/metadata")
public Metadata updateMetadata(@RequestBody
                                                              Metadata metadataDetails)
        PUT to update metadata details in the database. Code always acts as if there is one (and only one) record in the DB, even if it's empty; if no record exists to be updated, a new one is created instead. For this reason, the ID is always 1.
        Parameters:
        metadataDetails - The data to be updated in the DB
        Returns:
        The updated Metadata object

      • getAllConversations

        @GetMapping(value="/conversations")
public java.util.List<Conversation> getAllConversations()
        GET request for listing all conversations
        Returns:
        List of all conversations in the database

public Conversation getConversationById(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                 java.lang.Long conversationID)

      • getConversationByParticipant

        @GetMapping(value="/conversations/{participantName}")
public Conversation getConversationByParticipant(@RequestParam(value="participantName")
                                                                                                       java.lang.String participantName)
        GET to return a single conversation, by participant name
        Parameters:
        participantName - Name of the participant
        Returns:
        Single Conversation

      • getConversationByParticipantIdOrName

        @GetMapping(value="/conversations/id/{participantId}/{participantName}")
public Conversation getConversationByParticipantIdOrName(@RequestParam(value="participantId")
                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String participantId,
                                                                                                                                  @RequestParam(value="participantName")
                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String participantName)
        GET to return a single conversation, by participant ID. Because some conversations (where all messages are from the main blog, and none are from the participant) will have no conversation ID, a backup method is provided whereby conversations can be searched by Participant Name instead of ID.
        Parameters:
        participantId - ID of the participant
        participantName - Name of the participant; not used if ID is successfully used to retrieve a Conversation
        Returns:
        Single Conversation

      • getUnhiddenConversations

        @GetMapping(value="/conversations/unhidden")
public java.util.List<Conversation> getUnhiddenConversations()
        Returns all conversations that are not set to "hidden" status
        Returns:
        List of conversations

      • createConversation

        @PostMapping(value="/conversations")
public Conversation createConversation(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                            @Valid Conversation conversation)
        POST request to submit a conversation into the system
        Parameters:
        conversation - The conversation object (in JSON format) to be saved into the database
        Returns:
        The same object that was saved (including the generated ID)

      • updateConversation

        @PutMapping(value="/conversations/{id}")
public Conversation updateConversation(@PathVariable(value="id")
                                                                                java.lang.Long conversationId,
                                                                                @RequestBody
                                                                                Conversation convoDetails)
        PUT to update a conversation
        Parameters:
        conversationId - ID of the convo to be updated
        convoDetails - Details to be inserted into the DB
        Returns:
        The updated Conversation details

      • ignoreConversation

        @PutMapping(value="/conversations/{participant}/ignoreConvo")
public Conversation ignoreConversation(@PathVariable(value="participant")
                                                                                                     java.lang.String participantName)
        Sets a conversation to "ignored" status
        Parameters:
        participantName - Name of the participant in the conversation to be ignored
        Returns:
        Updated Conversation

      • unignoreConversation

        @PutMapping(value="/conversations/{participant}/unignoreConvo")
public Conversation unignoreConversation(@PathVariable(value="participant")
                                                                                                         java.lang.String participantName)
        Sets a conversation to "un-ignored" status
        Parameters:
        participantName - Name of the participant in the conversation to be ignored
        Returns:
        Updated Conversation

      • unignoreAllConversations

        @GetMapping(value="/conversations/unignoreAllConversations")
public void unignoreAllConversations()
        Used to reset all conversations back to an un-hidden state
